intro: Stemodia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile stemodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
